items.question: How do you identify which processes can be automated?
items.answer: We conduct a thorough audit of your operations to detect repetitive, slow, or error-prone tasks. Then we prioritize based on impact and ease of implementation. We focus on processes with clear rules, high execution frequency, and quick return on investment.

items.question: Does automation replace my team?

items.question: What happens if my processes change in the future?

items.question: When will I start seeing results?
items.answer: In most cases, returns start to be noticeable between 2 and 6 months. Youâ€™ll see improvements from the start: fewer errors, more speed, and time saved. We measure everything with clear metrics such as hours saved and optimized processes.

items.question: Can it integrate with the systems I already use?

items.question: What technical support do you offer afterwards?

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions

items.question: What level of access do you need to our systems?
items.answer: Depending on the type of analysis, we may require read-only access to source code, development or staging environments, and technical documentation. For performance analysis, we access logs, metrics, and system configurations. We always work under strict confidentiality agreements and, when necessary, use anonymized data. We never access sensitive production data without explicit supervision.

items.question: Will the analysis affect the normal operation of the system?
items.answer: No. Our approach is non-intrusive and mainly performed on development, staging, and historical data environments. If production observation is needed, we use passive tools that do not interfere with performance. Risky tests are planned with your team and executed during low-activity periods.

items.question: What exactly does the analysis report include?
items.answer: It includes: an executive summary, detailed analysis by area (code, architecture, performance, security), a prioritized list of issues, technical recommendations with implementation estimates, and an action roadmap. We also add technical annexes with metrics and evidence, plus a presentation session to address your teamâ€™s questions.

items.question: Can you help implement the recommended improvements?
items.answer: Yes. We can directly implement improvements, work alongside your technical team, or provide supervision and advice during the process. We also offer specific training for your team to incorporate the best practices and suggested technologies.

items.question: How often do you recommend performing an analysis?
items.answer: For critical systems, we suggest at least an annual review. For rapidly growing applications, every 6-12 months. Stable systems can be reviewed every 2-3 years. items.question: How do you evaluate the digital maturity level of my company?
items.answer: We use a structured framework that analyzes your processes, tools, team, and digital culture. Through interviews, technical audits, and functional analysis, we obtain a clear view of your starting point and design recommendations to move forward with confidence.

items.question: How long does a complete digital transformation take?

items.question: How do you ensure the recommended tools are the right ones?
items.answer: We don't sell software. We evaluate your processes, needs, and resources. Then we analyze different market options and help you choose the best solution based on functionality, cost, scalability, and support.

items.question: Do you offer support after implementation?
items.answer: Yes. We provide accompaniment according to your needs: follow-up sessions, answering questions, monitoring key metrics, and adjustments based on results. Our goal is that the transformation works in the long term.

items.question: What return can I expect from digitalization?
items.answer: Results vary, but our clients typically see 20-40% improvements in efficiency and 15-30% reductions in operational costs. We set metrics from the start so you can measure real impact and adjust as needed.

items.question: How does phased development work and why is it better?
items.answer: Phased development allows launching the first module quickly and obtaining value from the start. Each phase delivers a ready-to-use functionality. This reduces risk, improves budget control, and allows adapting the software as your company evolves.

items.question: What technologies do you use and how do you ensure scalability?
items.answer: We work with modern technologies like React, Next.js, Node.js, and PostgreSQL. We design software with modular architecture and well-defined APIs, allowing scaling users, features, or integrating new systems without redoing previous work.

items.question: What does each phase include besides development?
items.answer: Each phase includes detailed planning, development, automated testing, technical and functional documentation, and deployment support. You can also get post-launch support or continue with the next phase whenever you want.

items.question: Can I add features after development?
items.answer: Yes, our modular approach is designed exactly for that. You can add new modules or integrate external services without affecting what's already built. The software evolves with your business.

items.question: Do you offer support and maintenance after launch?
items.answer: Yes. We provide basic support (bug fixes, security updates) and evolutionary support with continuous improvements, optimization, and new features development. We adapt to your needs.

items.question: How long does it take to recover the investment?
items.answer: Many SMEs see returns from the first phase. For example, by automating repetitive tasks, improving data control, or reducing human errors. We help you measure impact from the start with clear metrics like time saved or errors avoided.
